description: From Ancient Greek [Term?] (“ἀνατρέπω, to overturn, upset, refute”).

entries.meaning: rebutting; overthrowing; defeating; applied to Plato's refutative dialogues.
examples: The Agonistic dialogues , supposed to resemble the combat , were either Endeictic, as exhibiting a specimen of skill , or Anatreptic, presenting the spectacle of a perfect defeat .
